Text saved: Knowing about the possible differences in what people expect and how they act can help us stop bad communication. But it is very important that we also remember that cultural `stereotypes`, which are fixed ideas about how all people from a country or group are, can be bad for making good business relationships. Even though cultures from different countries can change the way we act and think, we are also mostly influenced by the area we come from, the groups we belong to, our age and gender (whether we are male or female), our company's culture, and our personal experiences of the world. For this reason, we should keep the knowledge of these possible differences in our minds, instead of using it to put all people from a whole country into one group.
